text: The Iona was Scottish-built paddle steamer, purchased by Confederate agents for use as a blockade runner during the American Civil War. Following a collision with Chanticleer she sunk in the Upper Clyde near Fort Matilda in October 1862. The wreck, which lies around 27 m below chart datum, is now designated as a Historic Marine Protected Area by Historic Environment Scotland. ==References== Category:1855 ships Category:Ships built on the River Clyde Category:Merchant ships of the United Kingdom Category:Paddle steamers of the United Kingdom Category:Maritime incidents in October 1862 Category:Protected Wrecks of Scotland Category:Blockade runners of the American Civil War Category:Historic Marine Protected Areas of Scotland
title: PS Iona (1855)
